block.p: Kempley Atterbury Salerno and Charles Walsworth Bryant, teachers at the Episcopal Academy in Merion, Pa., were married on Friday in Cornwall, Conn. The Rev. Dr. Douglas Green performed the ceremony at the United Church of Christ, Congregational.

Mrs. Bryant, 27, a French teacher, graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in French from Middlebury College. She is a daughter of Dr. Christina Salerno and Dr. Richard Salerno of Newtown, Conn. The bride's father, a retired otolaryngologist, is the president of InfoRx, a medical consulting concern in Newtown. Her mother is an educational consultant in Newtown.

Kempley Atterbury Salerno and Charles Walsworth Bryant, teachers at the Episcopal Academy in Merion, Pa., were married on Friday in Cornwall, Conn. The Rev. Dr. Douglas Green performed the ceremony at the United Church of Christ, Congregational.

Mrs. Bryant, 27, a French teacher, graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in French from Middlebury College. She is a daughter of Dr. Christina Salerno and Dr. Richard Salerno of Newtown, Conn. The bride's father, a retired otolaryngologist, is the president of InfoRx, a medical consulting concern in Newtown. Her mother is an educational consultant in Newtown.

Mr. Bryant, 35, teaches history and coaches girls' varsity basketball. He graduated from Haverford College and received a master's degree in teaching from Trenton State College. He is a son of Jean and Jack Bryant of Cornwall. The bridegroom's mother retired as a librarian at the Berkshire School in Sheffield, Mass. His father retired as a librarian at the Maryland Institute of Art in Baltimore.
